author: phklive
content:
Hey all, while reading specifications i had a question pop-up in my mind. 

The beacon chain is not block based like POW but slot based hence every slot ( 12 seconds ) consensus clients need to run x and y behaviour. 

My question is as follows, how does a new consensus client connecting to the network sync to the time ( tick ) of other clients on the network? 

Or is it not needed? 

I have the feeling that all clients should be able to run behaviour at the same time every 12 seconds and not follow their personal clock. 

Thx ðŸ˜Š

author: sauliusgrigaitis
content: It doesn't sync to the time of the other clients. It just syncs its clock and hopes it's the right time. AFAIK some clients warn if there is some clock drift (the client observes many messages too early/too late in the network).

author: cyberroninn
content:
+ afaik clock drift is not much of a problem because each client will eventually sync with the network
-- time is relative within networks anyway, so when a client joins a network, it's comparing its time with other client's time within the network and then adjusting as required, this is how it syncs with the network as i understand. 
if a client doesnt meet a 12s slot, it will meet the next one

author: potuz
content: this is not the case, no client (that I know of) will adjust the time. This was the main reason for the Medalla incident and ever since the only client that adjusted time has backed up from it

author: sproul
content: Yes, most clients sync using NTP and hope for the best. Removing our reliance on NTP would be an interesting area of research

author: sproul
content: At the moment if your clock is out of sync your performance will suffer: attestations may not get aggregated, or included at all

author: ajsutton
content: I strongly suspect there's way more incentive to keep the world's server's time in sync than there is for just Ethereum nodes to stay in sync with time accurately. So I suspect the solutions other people come up with will likely be better than what we can and we should just use them.
